net.sf.sprockets.app

Class NavigationDrawerToggle

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle
      • net.sf.sprockets.app.NavigationDrawerToggle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DrawerLayout.DrawerListener

    public class NavigationDrawerToggle
extends ActionBarDrawerToggle
    Manages the ActionBar of an Activity that contains a navigation DrawerLayout according to the Android design guidelines. The standard navigation drawer indicator is displayed, a shadow is applied to the navigation drawer, when the drawer is opened the ActionBar navigation mode is set to standard and the title is changed to the app name, and when the drawer is closed the ActionBar is restored to its previous state.

    Opening and closing the navigation drawer also invalidates the options menu and your onCreateOptionsMenu method(s) should only add Activity-specific items when the drawer is not open.

    See ActionBarDrawerToggle for Activity callbacks that must call methods in this class. Or your Activity may extend NavigationDrawerActivity and these calls will be handled for you.

    • Method Detail

      • setActionModePresentersSupplier

        public NavigationDrawerToggle setActionModePresentersSupplier(Supplier<List<ActionModePresenter>> supplier)
        When the navigation drawer is opened, ask the ActionModePresenters to hide any ActionMode. When the navigation drawer is closed, ask them to restore any ActionMode that was hidden.
        Parameters:
        supplier - may supply null when there are no ActionModePresenters

      • setDrawerListener

        public NavigationDrawerToggle setDrawerListener(DrawerLayout.DrawerListener listener)
        Forward navigation drawer events to the listener after they are processed here.
